website_summaries.verdict: This starter kit comes with a genuine Arduino board and more than 190 parts and components to get you started. And the included book is written on a level students can understand.
pros: Kit comes with genuine  Arduino Uno Rev3 board
Enough components for hundreds of projects
Comes with more than 190 parts and components, including breadboard holder, jumper wires, USB cable, LEDs, DC motor, small Servo and relay
Kit also features a 72 page full-color instruction manual
cons: Some components may be missing from kit or may not arrive in working condition

customer_reviews.title: Documentation is EXCELLENT
customer_reviews.text: I almost never leave feedback good or bad, so this is an exception for me. I purchased this kit for my daughter as an introduction to Electrical Engineering. I myself a EE for ... a very long time. I was 100% impressed by the starter kit guide. To be honest I have never seen better documentation. The guide by itself is worth twice the cost of the kit. Just absolutely, positively well done. It gave me insight as to how I can better write my documents.
customer_reviews.author: habworks

customer_reviews.title: Makes Learning  F : U : N  for Everyone
customer_reviews.text: Everything you need to get started with electronics and experimentation with equipment like the color diode included. You can power the Arduino by hooking the board to a USB port on your computer ( Mac, Windows or Linux ) or plug in the 9-Volt battery adapter included in the kit and you're ready to Rock-and-Roll [ The 9-Volt battery is not included, just the adapter for it. ] I learned a lot and had fun doing it. The booklet included goes into detail on what needs to be on hand and how to proceed. The instructions are clear and easy to follow.
customer_reviews.author: chris christopher

customer_reviews.title: A great Kit! Can't say enough good about it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect set! I bought it for myself to have a refresher with electronics and play with Arduino. Within a week, my 7 year old is making his own circuits from the user guide(he had never touched circuits before). The guide is really easy to follow and starts at an easy level. The sample code is really well documented. I am going have to get another one as now my 6 year old wants to play too! Having their names come up on the LCD was like xmas! :) They cover the majority of basics, i do wish there were some capacitors and a couple more different resistors in the kit. (Not a complaint at all, but suggestion)
customer_reviews.author: T. McL.

customer_reviews.title: Great kit!
customer_reviews.text: As far as the hardware goes, there is nothing that I don't love about this kit. That being said, this is my first foray into physical computing, so I don't know that I would know the difference in quality. The instruction guide is pretty easy to follow, and the projects are great for beginners. I only wish that there was more information included on HOW the things work. I feel like knowing how circuits and electricity work is crucial to being able to branch out into my own projects instead of following someone else's step-by-step instructions. Other than that, a terrific kit for beginners interested is seeing what this is all about.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Save yourself some trouble and buy a decent breadboard.
customer_reviews.text: The breadboard is of such low quality as to make it useless. Components plugged into it may or may not be making connection as one would expect. As a result, it's very difficult to know if your circuit is a bad design or something simply isn't making contact. Frustrating at best. Neat idea ruined by one critical component that was simply too cheap and poorly made to be of any use at all.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: It was missing 7 Different Parts
customer_reviews.text: Got it just yesterday, and it was missing 7 pieces. They include the following.... 1. Potentiometer 2. Photoresister 3. Temperature Sensor 4. Piezo Element 5. Transistor 6. Diode 7. Relay Either they forgot to put in the bag or not, I am severely disappointed since most of the projects need one of the 7 pieces which are missing Plus, the book doesn't really explain the schematic on why the circuitry looks the way they do.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Control your world
customer_reviews.text: There seem to have been some reviews about missing and broken pieces, but my kit worked 100%. The included booklet of experiments is a fantastic way to get started. In just one evening I felt like I had mastered the basics. I was never certain what the point of the Arduino was, until this guide and kit walked me through the possibilities. Turning a few lines of code into a flashing, moving, beeping creature is very powerful. I love the Arduino now and will be getting into more of this as a direct result of this kit.
customer_reviews.author: D. Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Good value good product
customer_reviews.text: Originally bought this kit for a college class and though I'm not really too much into robotics or Electronics the kit itself is very good and the the board is very well made the whole kit is actually an excellent A+ kit for anyone that is really much more into robotics than me this is a great kit and the Arduino is a very intelligent system you can program and C C plus plus or the environment it's very good for only $40 you got yourself an amazing little computer
customer_reviews.author: IRON DESIGNER

customer_reviews.title: Good little starter kit
customer_reviews.text: I've been a software engineer for 35 years from assembly language up to c#. Even with my background, I thought it was a nice little starter kit. Yea most examples are ridiculously simple, but you have to start somewhere. After the examples you'll be able to branch out to real projects. If you need something for your project after this kit, seriously consider going to Adafruit to get your stuff. They deserve our support. Solid products and complete tutorials to get their products up with minimal fuss.
customer_reviews.author: davidTop Contributor: Arduino

customer_reviews.title: Simple.  Nice intro to microprocessors.  Slow execution speed (as expected).
customer_reviews.text: I found the setup to be easy. I had to do a little searching online to figure out which software I should download to edit the programs, but it wasn't too bad. It's execution speed is slow, but that's to be expected. It comes with a small manual with simple projects to try. Those worked fine. It does not assume any significant prior experience with circuits although that certainly helps. This is good for an introduction to simple microprocessors connected to hardware. Some people do fairly sophisticated things with Arduinos, but if you want more power, Raspberry Pi might be a better choice. I'm still happy with my Arduino though.
customer_reviews.author: Aero-Mech

customer_reviews.title: Learning kit? HA
customer_reviews.text: Not really a learning kit at all, No explanations at all of programming the Arduino just download the code. No explanation of the electronics or how they work, not even Ohms Law, Book consists only of diagrams of the circuits, no explanation at all of what or why. So to call this a learning tool is a joke. It does provide some basic starter parts albeit not really worth the price and don't expect to learn much
customer_reviews.author: Diane Carel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent learning tool for both Professionals and Students
customer_reviews.text: I'm a mechanical engineer that wanted to learn the BASICS of electronics and control. This has taught me that without making me learn too deeply into the electrical engineering theory. The projects are clean and easy, the code is somewhat similar to C, and the value for this package as an educational tool is incredible. It will work for senior mechanical engineers like myself and kids alike. This is great to both test your interest in the electronics industry as well as to segway into learning the basics.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: I took the leap into Arduino! I'm designing a control circuit for LED daytime running lamps in my new car and wanted the LED's to be off, on bright, and on dim based on specific conditions. Since I have a bit of VB script programming experience this was an easy jump into the Arduino version of C++. I wouldn't want to discourage anyone from buying the product but you really need a technical mind to be able to grasp a lot of what's going on with wiring and programming this item. I couldn't be happier and the booklet that comes with it is a very nice bonus!
customer_reviews.author: Rio555

customer_reviews.title: OK starter kit but....
customer_reviews.text: No explanation for diagrams and no troubleshooting guides. Experiment 10 has the positive and negative hooked up backwards for the motor. I've seen some comments saying they were given a bad motor. No, you were just told to hook it up backwards which just made it humm instead of rotate. But overall i would buy again, because its cheap for a lot of gadgets to play with. Just learn arduino buy yourself with experimenting.
customer_reviews.author: Trent

customer_reviews.title: Great.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent kit, legitimate Arduino (not a knockoff like many of the other kits), great little booklet of projects with hugely useful illustrations and diagrams that help walk you through it every step of the way. Contains everything you need to get started and enough information to keep you experimenting. Would absolutely recommend for anyone looking to get into electronics, regardless of age group. Unlike a lot of electronics kits everything you need is already in the box, so you can get started immediately without making any further purchases. The only thing you might want to add is a 9v battery for the included 9v power supply, but it'll also function off of a standard USB port. Can't recommend it enough.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Fun for teaching to the beginners
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an affordable kit to teach principles of embedded systems to freshmen students. After a search, I decided to get Vilros Arduino Uno 3 Ultimate Starter Kit. The kit was complete,and included a lab book which was really helpful. The kit included almost all the necessary accessories that you need for your instructional purposes. I used both simple c programming and MATLAB assisted task. It was fun for myself and the students alike. A great experience. The only problem that I had was with the motor. I suggest the provider includes a higher quality motor.
customer_reviews.author: H Pedram

customer_reviews.title: Perfect kit for Arduino beginners!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent Arduino kit for beginners like myself. The manual is concise and explains step by step how to set up each circuit and program the Arduino. Pros: beginner friendly nice variety of parts included very informative manual with tutorials that increase in difficulty and complexity as you advance through the manual. Cons: The sled (black plastic piece that both the Arduino and breadboard sit on) was very difficult to attach the Arduino to. I felt that i would bend or break the Arduino while trying to attach it. I ended up buying a different sled. This was the only piece from the kit that I had trouble with.. Overall I was very pleased and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MNorris

customer_reviews.title: lots of parts, great book for beginners
customer_reviews.text: very easy to use and lots of parts for projects. I bought this as in intro so that I could learn how to code and build things. this was perfect and now I building projects for my car, camping and robots. the book is easy to follow and has cool projects
customer_reviews.author: Khaos

customer_reviews.title: It's a Good Starter Kit
customer_reviews.text: The kit arrived on-time and has all the basic parts to get you started with making things. The circuit diagrams are easy to understand. There were some drawbacks. For example, the link to the website for sample programs doesn't work, so it requires some digging around on the internet to get to. There were several missing components. Customer service took a few days to respond, but were helpful in sending out the missing components. I will admit that this "starter kit" doesn't help you very much with the programming side. It works best if you don't use the sample programs and try making it yourself using the open-source resources on the Arduino website.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Nixt

customer_reviews.title: I bought this package because it contained most of the ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this package because it contained most of the basic parts for learning to use Arduino. Both my roommate and I purchased one from that same seller. Each of the motor components broke within one use. The wires are poorly soldered and snapped off when trying to use the motor. I handled the parts very gently, they literally broke when plugging them into the Uno board. Don't buy this package as you will need to re-solder parts since they break.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Possible counterfeit?
customer_reviews.text: The arduino uno looks really cool. My raspberry pi didn't recognize it as a USB device, but it worked right away the first time on a laptop running Ubuntu. But then two other computers couldn't recognize it and we started doing some research. I now suspect it may be a counterfeit made of lower quality parts. See the official arduino counterfeit website for details.  It stopped working on the laptop too, and we are returning it :(
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Buck

customer_reviews.title: Good...except they make you register with their commercial website for the code
customer_reviews.text: I'd give it 5 stars if they didn't force you to give your name and email before they'll let you download the code that makes the kit usable. Even more annoying is that there's no indication that that's a requirement -- until you're logged in, the URL they provide in the book just redirects to their homepage. I was getting annoyed when I noticed the "Log In" and "Join" links at the top and thought to myself "if this is what's wrong...these people are jerks." And, yep, that was the case. Definitely strikes me as against the spirit of Arduino.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Vier

customer_reviews.title: GREAT KIT, having trouble with circuit #10? read My review
customer_reviews.text: Kit is AWESOME, one down side that's why I took a star off. The Kit comes with a DC motor (not sure of the actual specs assuming its 1.5v-3.0v 300+ mA) and is used on Circuit #10 in the instruction manual Arduino states minimum 6v for the UNO board. When connected to the USB on Your PC its only receiving 5v DC (minus losses can put You as low as 4 mine was 4.7v) this is enough to work up to this point. When You enter a speed into the Serial Monitor window the motor will try to start drawing on the board lowering the voltage to the point the Arduino board freezes. Hope this helps someone
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Hoover II

customer_reviews.title: Impressed with kit
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed with the contents of this kit. It had everything needed to run multiple examples and I thought the examples were well written to give you a good introduction to the capabilities of the Arduino. I have some coding experience but little wiring experience and was quickly combining the different examples. I'm excited to get another few sensors and utilize the Arduino in some fun applications. I'm also excited to teach my kids some of the possible applications of this powerful little device.
customer_reviews.author: Hybrid piper

customer_reviews.title: Original made in Italy
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for fun, and it actually turned out to be really useful. Learned a lot form the Arduino community. This products provides the basic components to use the Arduino. Also, it comes with a beautiful manual that can be easily fallowed to build awesome projects
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts - not happy. UPDATE - received parts
customer_reviews.text: Missing parts. I'm missing the Servo and DC Motor. Sent email to Vilros support. I will update depending on how they respond. EDIT: They responded pretty quickly and I got my pissing parts within a couple days. Updated the rating to 4/5 stars as I shouldn't have had the missing parts to begin with. Vilros needs better quality control to prevent this from happening. I've bought a lot of stuff in my life and this is the first time I've had missing parts in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent starter kit!
customer_reviews.text: As near as I can tell, it's not a knockoff board, and everything has been working nicely. I have had a couple bad jumper wires, but the general quality and amount of components has made up for that lack. And it's not like you don't have plenty of other wires to work with. Definitely has helped me dust off my old electronics interest and get back in gear after 15 years out of the hobby.
customer_reviews.author: Peregrine

customer_reviews.title: Great Kit!
customer_reviews.text: Great kit, but check the USB cable if a com port doesn't show up in setup. Spent about 5 hours trying to troubleshoot the problem. The board LED lights were on, but when I pulled another gold plated Cable off of a printer and used that, it instantly initialized and I was in business. Still giving 5 stars, the kit itself has all you need to get started.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Jones

customer_reviews.title: This is a great starter kit
customer_reviews.text: This is a great starter kit. Everything arrived in great condition. Everything worked fine and was nicely packaged. This is my first time learning anything about arduino and electronics so it was an interesting transition but it was an easy learning curve with this kit and the book with projects. If you want to get into arduino, the best way is to dive and and do it. You can finish most of the projects in a weekend but can do so much more than just the book if you research more.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent starter kit for the hobbyist
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent starter kit for anyone wanting to get familiar with the Arduino. I am a TA in my university's engineering department and this is the kit we recommend for our instrumentation class. The included tutorial circuits and included booklet are very well designed and the accompanying code is very well commented. The comments do an excellent job explaining what the code means and why things are formatted as they are. If you want to introduce yourself to the Arduino and some of the different sensors and other basic electronics components, I highly recommend this kit.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: You can use the Arduino as just a USB power source for beginner electronic circuits education, then move on to programming if you wish. I and my 10 years old son both learn new things while playing with it. Contacted support about the broken motor wire, they immediately replaced it, good experience. This kit has very good instruction manual with beginners lessons. Comes in a cardboard box.
customer_reviews.author: VT

customer_reviews.title: yo m8 get this
customer_reviews.text: This is a great deal of you're just getting started with Arduino. The packaging was nice and solid upon arrival. Within there are a lot of components to experiment with and the guide book is awesome. One of my favorites is the temp sensor, and along with the LCD I was able to build a simple thermostat with help from online codes. I recommend this product to anyone tech savvy or to anyone that likes C programming. Also, this Arduino is the real thing and buying it helps support the devs :)
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Great starter kit
customer_reviews.text: Very good kit, nice but short accompanying projects book, teaches you enough to get you hooked and wanting to experiment more! Comes in a typical white cardboard box packaging, nothing fancy. But the contents is great, and opening it was like Christmas day when you are 8 years old. Disappointed with the flimsy black plastic plate for the Arduino and Breadboard, as it was damaged and I had to drill a hole and add a tiny screw to make sure the Arduino stayed attached. Secondly no RGB LED was included! Hence only 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: C0d3r.N3T

customer_reviews.title: Excellent kit
customer_reviews.text: Perfect beginners kit. The manual is fantastic, excellent illustrations in color. It has a holder for the Arduino and the breadboard side by side, a really nice touch. The only thing missing is a stepper motor. I highly recommend this kit.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Santana

customer_reviews.title: Good buy to get you started on Arduino
customer_reviews.text: The Arduino UNO board is genuine. The package and all components are nice and not cheap. The booklet that comes with it is first class. I just wish it included more projects. I found one mistake in of the circuit (the diode orientation is reversed), which a bit of challenge before I make it worked. But nonetheless I'm giving it a five star. Recommended to get you started. My suggestion to those who want to learn Arduino, get a starter kit like this and get also some other books on Arduino as complementary. Also if you're new to electronics I recommend this book  (Getting Started in Electronics by Forrest M. Mims III)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best arduino starter kit
customer_reviews.text: This is the best arduino kit that I have found on Amazon. With the price you are paying for it is worth every penny because it is hard to find a good kit that comes with the necessary components for basic projects or to learn about the arduino. It is 100% the Uno R3 board and made in Italy. You get everything in the picture, nothing more, nothing less. Got this for a school project and would recommend it as gifts for students who want to tinker with things. It is also good for anyone who likes to build things.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Love this kit
customer_reviews.text: Love this kit! There is a book that goes with it and it is pretty amazing. Book will teach a lot of things that are useful for beginners. Though the instruction for downloading the content are old. When you go via hyperlink from the book to the website to download the examples you will get the zip file. Unzip it on your desktop and then moved the folder to the arduino library. Do not unzip it to the arduino library initially!
customer_reviews.author: Sergey

customer_reviews.title: Perfect starter and a genuine Arduino Uno
customer_reviews.text: Great starter kit. Many of the items I would have bought were included, making this a no brainer. The Arduino Uno is the real deal. I went to the Arduino site and verified it using their methods. A way to organize the pieces/parts would have been a huge plus, but it came with everything that was listed (and maybe some extras that I didn't see originally). I did find that the instructions contradicted on one of the project. If I remember correctly, the schematic is correct, but the procedure is wrong.
customer_reviews.author: R. Dietz

customer_reviews.title: Includes a pamphlet made by Sparkfun
customer_reviews.text: Received the Arduino Uno Rev3 Ultimate Starter Kit with a no-nonsense, beautifully prepared, color illustrated Starter Kit GUIDE. The Guide includes a Visual Inventory of Parts, Detailed Circuits to Assemble, and instructions on many 'real world' applications to assemble and run. [The DC Motor had only one wire soldered to it, instead of the two wires that were needed, so in all fairness I could not give the Kit the perfect score]. Very pleased by the professionalism that was shown in putting this Kit together. Thumbs up! Definitely a Five star product.
customer_reviews.author: VeeMat

customer_reviews.title: Not ready for prime time.
customer_reviews.text: The simple circuits that come with the arduino in this package work, but try to get the LCD working or a sensor and you run into trying to find, download and properly locate various libraries files, that don't work together or can't be found, etc. I will probably eventually make things work, but it is not because they are working out of the box, as advertised, or as documented. The LCD, for instance, is a nightmare! Have fun!
customer_reviews.author: DHG

customer_reviews.title: Neat little computer
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my daughter as a birthday gift, and she's really enjoyed playing with it. A few pieces were missing from the original kit, but Vilros quickly sent replacement pieces that worked just fine. The Arduino unit itself has been working just fine, and we have had fun doing a bunch of different things with the LCD display. A great tool for learning basic circuits and programming skills.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Cool

customer_reviews.title: Valuable kit
customer_reviews.text: I already have another Arduino but I need one more board for another new project. This starter kit is better than I expected. It has everything you need to have for starting any basic Arduino projects, even for adding some additional parts with new Arduino board to your current project like my case. Especially I really like the guidebook which has about 72 pages and very informative graphics so that you can understand how you should connect each part to Arduino and how every part will work with each other easily. Value pack.
customer_reviews.author: xoundbox

customer_reviews.title: It's a good way to start, but...
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1. Very quick start, easy to understand. 2. You can go through the whole booklet in hours. Cons: 1. One component wasn't working (Servo Motor), and I took a long time to realize that it was not my mistake, but a component problem. 2. One of the two wires of the motor was not attached to the motor. I didn't have a soldering iron at that time, and I had to find "alternative" ways to attach it. 3. The programs aren't explained in the booklet, and I had to understand them using three sources, simultaneously: the booklet, the Arduino IDE and the circuit. 4. I found others kits on the Internet with more interesting circuits, including LCD.
customer_reviews.author: Almir Campos

customer_reviews.title: Electronics!
customer_reviews.text: Good starter kit. I'm an electronics student entering my second year. Wish I had this kit before I started, the experiments that come with the kit are pretty basic for a second year student. It did help me understand the basics of how coding/programming works. For someone that has no knowledge of electronics, this is a great way to start. More advanced users can find all sorts of stuff online to build. The extra jumper leads and LEDs are helpful to have for other electronics projects. Good buy for the $.
customer_reviews.author: Swesnw

customer_reviews.title: Working great so far
customer_reviews.text: Working great so far. I've done a couple projects with it and working on one now. The set is also a great introduction to the arduino projects and the book is really helpful in explaining how to set it up. As a beginner, it really helped me understand how it work and the basics to the arduino
customer_reviews.author: ChrisN

customer_reviews.title: Great way to learn Arduino
customer_reviews.text: Vilros does a very good job of putting together a kit that gets you familiar and comfortable with the arduino platform. Working through the examples can seem a little tedious - nobody starts out with the goal of blinking a light... they want to build robots and complex things... but each example teaches a little more, and helps you get to the point where you can implement your own ideas
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Hutchison

customer_reviews.title: Best fun and educational tool out there for electronics!
customer_reviews.text: Learning more about Arduino has taught me so much more about electronics then I could have learned any other way. I bought this kit a year ago. I already had a lot of electronic experience before, but not any experience with digital electronics and programming. I bought this with the book "Arduino for Dummies" and I have come a long way. You can build anything with Arduino. It is so much fun! Great kit for any geek who loves electronics, automation, and robotics!
customer_reviews.author: I can be helpful sometimesTop Contributor: Ham Radio

customer_reviews.title: Great Kit!
customer_reviews.text: Great kit with a good book on how to use your Arduino. If you have any programming experience at all (I had previously used VBA and Matlab) you will pick up what this book is throwing down easily. Comes with a nice assortment of sensors that are all used in projects in the book, and that get your mind going on how you could build something else of your own. If you're thinking about it at all, get it.
customer_reviews.author: Jordie

customer_reviews.title: it is truly great..
customer_reviews.text: Broke a few component terminals.. i.e. the button, the speaker and the leads came off of the motor. No big deal just need to solder it back on. Other than that.. it is truly great... hours of fun.. academia.com has a great starter book called Beginning Arduino Programming. Try it out
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic beginner's kit!
customer_reviews.text: This product is EXACTLY as described, with official Arduino board and all. The project book is pretty solid if a bit basic (and doesn't cover the LCD screen). The leads are great with varied colors and lengths (I actually wish there were FEWER colors so I could more easily color code signal wires). The breadboard is meh quality but good enough for casual prototyping; the leads will very occasionally free themselves.
customer_reviews.author: S. M. Pitman

customer_reviews.title: Our University teaches Arduino
customer_reviews.text: UNM mechanical engineering students have to learn how to sense things and how to control things. This kit is an excellent start on doing just that.
customer_reviews.author: Craig S Davidson

customer_reviews.title: One of the best starter kits!
customer_reviews.text: Great kit to get started! Comes with everything you need, and all of the components seem to be quality. The only real complaint is that the black plastic base that the breadboard and Arduino attach to is not flat, but it's minor and doesn't effect the workings of the components. The provided booklet is extremely clear and concise. Recommended for yourself or someone you know to get started with microcontrollers.
customer_reviews.author: Damian Harouff

customer_reviews.title: Great starter kit, has everything you need to start learning and prototyping.
customer_reviews.text: Prior to purchasing this starter kit, I really wanted to get into working on Arduino/electronic projects, but just didn't know where to start. This allowed me to just purchase the starter kit and have everything I need to play around and start some prototyping projects. I can't really complain about anything on this product, other than it has now cost me a lot more money as I've now purchased more and more parts and I'm hooked on making things. If you're looking to get started into Arduino/Electronics, get this!
customer_reviews.author: hooked82

customer_reviews.title: School necessities
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a class so I really can’t say too much. I would recommend this if you are looking to get an intro to circuits and designing your own circuits.
customer_reviews.author: nate com

customer_reviews.title: You could get an Uno separately for cheaper, but ...
customer_reviews.text: You could get an Uno separately for cheaper, but the totality of the package is well worth it. The manual takes you through some exercises, explains all of the reasoning behind the wiring, and takes your hand through the initial intro to working with these.
customer_reviews.author: Darek M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Kit for Beginners, Although Not 100% complete
customer_reviews.text: The tutorial book is well put together. The colored diagrams really help to decipher how the circuits work. The source code is also well documented. Each line of code has an explanation for what it does and how it corresponds to the physical devices on the board. Only thing that I didn't like was that it was advertised to come with a dc motor, servo motor and a diode, but my kit did not have these components. Also, some of the wording in the tutorial book is slightly different than the actual setup or results on the board. But the for the most part the tutorial matches the end result quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Toner

customer_reviews.title: Excellent starter kit
customer_reviews.text: I've wanted to get into electronics for a long time now; this kit is the perfect starting point. Relatively low-budget and a smooth learning curve make it a great way to break into the Arduino world. The manual for this particular kit contains a few very minor inconsistencies in directions or other minor errors, but they are not so bad as to mess you up if you're careful. Other than that, absolutely great product.
customer_reviews.author: American Honour

customer_reviews.title: Great kit
customer_reviews.text: Came ahead of schedule, very pleased. The instruction book that comes with explains everything you need to know to get started. The projects it gives you gets you used to the programming architecture without being boring. I highly recommend for anyone interested in the electronics industry. This is a great intro to arduino, once you start, you can do just about anything with.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Eggert

customer_reviews.title: Great kit!
customer_reviews.text: I did a bit of online comparisons and found this kit to be one of the better deals. I'm building a Remote Operated Vehicle, but never written much code. This kit and book make it really easy to get started, already writing code for my motor controllers! Hold off on buying the "Arduino" book - the kit comes with a good book to get started with. AND no kidding, I had hardly received the kit and they were calling me up to see if everything was Ok. That IS unusual.
customer_reviews.author: Miami

customer_reviews.title: Great starter kit!
customer_reviews.text: I have this kit as well, but I bought this one for my dad as a gift. I haven't priced everything out separately, so I don't know if you could get everything cheaper or not but it didn't seem egregiously overpriced. The tutorials are pretty easy to follow - you can download the source code for the projects if you just want to load them up, but I've found it's better to muddle through it yourself. Overall I think it's a solid beginners kit that opens the doors to useful and fun projects!
customer_reviews.author: Justin G

customer_reviews.title: Nice except for missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Everything was normal until I found that not a single resistor was in the box when I should have 90 of them. One star down. I then noticed that the plastic holder did not fit my board. One more star. When you pay $55 for a $15 circuit board, you'd expect everything to come with it. Not a big deal, except now I have to go Radioshack to try out a project or two. Maybe someone else had a better experience, but not me.
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Great kit for school
customer_reviews.text: Needed this for college. All the components worked and I have no complaints
customer_reviews.author: Vitaliy D.

customer_reviews.title: Good hardware--but the enclosed booklet might contain a few errors.
customer_reviews.text: The book that came with this unit contains a series of projects, requiring that the buyer register at their website to download the "Sketches" (short programs) needed. I found that requirement slightly irritating, especially when I found a number of forums online describing errors in the instructions. The actual hardware provided seems to be of good quality, however, so I gave this item a rating of 4 out of 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: Missing/Damaged Components, but still really fun.
customer_reviews.text: the board works and the bread board, but a lot of the LEDS have been damaged. Initially, the Resistors were not shipped. They quickly did send replaceents, but it was a dissapointment when I opened it. I don't know how many more components will be damaged, but it is frusterating. Hopefully they replace all of these also. In the end though, this is a great kit to learn on. The light sensor learning circuit was my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: AK47

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: Just what I wanted. Fairly inexpensive introduction to robotics, particularly the use of a microprocessor to control hardware devices. The book is easy to follow and the experiments easy to perform. If I had any complaint, it'd be a minor one: It would be nice if the book provided a deeper level of theory, a little more explanation of what exactly happens at each line of code entered and executed.
customer_reviews.author: RoboReader

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with my purchase. That said, I think if I had to do it again I would spend the time finding tutorials online and buy the necessary parts individually to complete them. The book that comes with it has great basic beginner tutorials, but you can find all of them online very easily. Better to spend the money on materials than on books and find the information online. Your mileage may vary.
customer_reviews.author: Oak

customer_reviews.title: Great for learning.
customer_reviews.text: The Kit comes with all the necessary hardware and guidance to help you get back to programming and structuring code again. I was impressed with the speed and functionality of this Microcontroller. If your interested in learning or shaking the dust off of your old programming skills (with some Electronics knowledge) this is a great way to get started.
customer_reviews.author: Larry P

customer_reviews.title: To date I am half way through the projects and feel like I'm learning what I set out to learn
customer_reviews.text: This kit was just as advertised and is providing me with some needed information. I am a WB8NKI since 1970 and have not been active for several years. Feeling that I needed to learn something about microprocessors. My plan is to construct an Iambic Keyer to use in transmitting with my QRP transmitter. To date I am half way through the projects and feel like I'm learning what I set out to learn.
customer_reviews.author: John Raile

customer_reviews.title: Do not look to the book to bring you up to speed on Arduino
customer_reviews.text: The hardware supplied is similar to most other kits and useful. The book does not perform as promised, and while the first 2 -3 pages help you get connected to the computer and make things work, the rest of the book is not at all useful, nor does it provide clear logical explanations of how the software is structured or works.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: I felt like a Pro
customer_reviews.text: By the time I had performed all the experiments, I felt like a Pro! This got me started into the fantastic world of Arduino. What a great way to do electronics! At the prices of the Uno R3, one can forget about building logic on PCB's, and just use a Uno for each task. Great product here.
customer_reviews.author: Don Evans

customer_reviews.title: Error massages need improving
customer_reviews.text: So far I have only completed the first two projects. I spent a great deal of time figuring out that the "(" symbol was not being used to define a function. On my laptop it is almost impossible to see the difference and I kept getting all kinds of error messages. None of them suggested I was using the wrong symbol which requires using the "shift" key to write it. Hope this helps to keep others from wasting a lot of time as I did!
customer_reviews.author: Raymoter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for learning about electronics
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for learning about electronics. There were a couple of errors in the tutorial instructions, but figuring out how to make those projects work correctly was satisfying nonetheless. The included 9v battery adaptor is especially nice so it can be run without being connected to the computer, but I ended up using a $5 portable USB charger with it.
customer_reviews.author: Larry E D

customer_reviews.title: Everything was amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This Arduino was great, all the parts came! I've only used it for 1 day though. I tested it with a flashing LED program and it worked like a charm. My only big concern was that the wires connected to the DC motors fell out, probably due to shipping. But that can be soldered or even taped back together in a minute. I was also surprised at the size of the whole thing. Everything was smaller that I expected, but it's all easy to use and shouldn't cause problems. The source code for everything is all included on the website mentioned in the instruction book as well. Overall outstanding product, greatly exceeded expectations!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a microcomputers college class. Everything seems to be there and working. Only thing is that they only give you 2 screws to hold the board onto the plastic. Wish there were 4 so you can put one in each hole in the board. Otherwise no problems for a person new to micros can say.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler L.

customer_reviews.title: I have really enjoyed this kit
customer_reviews.text: I have really enjoyed this kit. It's a fun and easy to get acquainted with both Arduino basics as well as component basics. My Arduino will ultimately but put to use controlling an automated chickrn coop door. I also am so impressed with the community of Arduino users who are willing to share their designs and solutions. This is a great learning tool and is ideal for kids and adults alike.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Berringer

customer_reviews.title: Nicely done! Too bad current boards are from Arduino.org, not Arduino.cc
customer_reviews.text: Nicely done! Unfortunately the boards are currently made by (somewhat evil) www.arduino.com. In the future hopefully Vilros can switch to new boards from AdaFruit that properly support www.Arduino.cc - the good guys. Those new boards aren't available yet however, so unless you can wait, this is the best option.
customer_reviews.author: John C

customer_reviews.title: Great kit!
customer_reviews.text: Faulty board, Having experience with other Unos, I could not get this one to work. I just so happen to get a bad one, but the kit is great and the manual really helps to clearly explain the setup of each circuit . Customer service was exceptional. They accepted a return and paid for shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Jonah Phillips

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT KIT
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS REALLY NICE KIT ITS COMPLETE AND VERY EDUCATIONAL, NOT JUST FOR BEGINNER, ITS LOTS OF FUN AND ALSO AFFORDABLE
customer_reviews.author: A.L designs

customer_reviews.title: Nice but not as pictured
customer_reviews.text: Could have been 5 stars if the pictures were accurate. The UNO board is different than what's pictured but it is an R3. There is no Ethernet shield. If you go by the list of parts and not the pictures you will most likely be satisfied with the kit.
customer_reviews.author: farmineer

customer_reviews.title: Not the official Arduino kit
customer_reviews.text: This starter kit is OK. I was under the impression this was an Official Arduino kit. The instructional book that comes with the the kit is a little sparce. I have used the official booklet and this one is just disappointing. 3 stars because a lot of information is free online.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: ... a while and I have been searching for a good starter kit
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting to get my kids into these for a while and I have been searching for a good starter kit, this is it. The instructions are amazing and it has all the parts you need for the several projects it has. The kit was complete enough that he was building custom projects right away with no other parts needed. My only issue is that the solder on the included motor wires is a bit weak and I had to reattach them after the first use, other than that if your looking for a great kit to get started with, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Up Life's Mountains

customer_reviews.title: Good microcontroller kit
customer_reviews.text: Had a lot of fun with this kit. Everything worked upon arrival, spent many hours programming different projects and learning microcontroller coding
customer_reviews.author: A. kolsrud

customer_reviews.title: Missing Parts
customer_reviews.text: Missing parts, specifically the servo and DC motor (two big ones). This product was otherwise as advertised. I really like the arduino and the concept behind this starter kit. However, you can't follow the starter guide without all the components, and you're not getting your money's worth if you have to go out and buy the missing pieces. I returned and opted not to try again, too much of a pain. Instead, I'll find a more reliable seller.
customer_reviews.author: damon

customer_reviews.title: Great jumpstart into Arduino!
customer_reviews.text: I have a more complex robotics project on-going, this kit helped me along light years. The abilities of the Arduino and the open interface for programming is awesome, and this kit guides you right thru some pretty cool projects. The understanding b/t the hardware and the software programming is awesome. Highly recommend this kit!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great kit to get you moving along on a project or experiementing with devices
customer_reviews.text: It is wonderful having a breadboard on the same backplane as the arduino as it helps keep the wiring tidy and less prone to pulling out. Plug and play. It was easy to setup. I also liked the assortment of components that came in the starter kit. Turns out some of lights, buzzer, buttons, etc made their way into permanent home automation projects too.
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: Good clean nerdy fun
customer_reviews.text: Zero previous coding/micro controller/Arduino experience. Great kit and fun little projects. I'm 38 years old and bought this for myself to learn more about electronics and the IOT.
customer_reviews.author: Whiskey Tango

customer_reviews.title: Lot of fun and learn
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun kit with carefully selected parts. It worked well and my son brought into the computer engineering world through the introduction of Arduino. Though both assembling and programming were new to him, through the projects with this kit he learned lot. And the fun that this kit brought to him kept him curious to pursue his own design project for possible real-life products.
customer_reviews.author: Min

customer_reviews.title: Awesome starter kit
customer_reviews.text: Wanted something that I could tie my electronics tinkering and my software development background together. Great fun and educational. Have no issues with the components, and even though I'm sure I could have bought it all separately for less, it was nice to not have to read around different sites to find out what I would "need" to get started with this stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Liviuslol

customer_reviews.title: Very Cool and affordable kit.
customer_reviews.text: Great deal, works as advertised. Will be a great learning tool. Very cool. All the items were there. Make sure you look at all the pictures, especially some of the circuit layouts before you attach the adruino to the bread board. Mine is upside down because I picked the wrong picture as my reference.
customer_reviews.author: VanStealth

customer_reviews.title: If you want an intro...
customer_reviews.text: This was the best one I could find. It has only a few experiments but the website and downloadable experiments take you beyond any startup. It has very well laid out starter's manual and will take the newbie to doing something original if you give it some thought. This is not a toy. If you are serious in learning some basics this will get you started quickly.
customer_reviews.author: MrWizard

customer_reviews.title: It's a great starter kit
customer_reviews.text: It's a great starter kit; I can't stop messing around with it, as there are seemingly an infinite amount of applications with just this kit. Vilros gives you all the necessary tools to delve into the world of electrical and computer engineering. However, the instructions booklet is a little outdated in the sense that it isn't updated to match the actual instructions within the software you are required to download. Unfortunately, it will take a little digging around in the Examples folder to find your desired sample code, or you can simply use Google to find the code. Very fun, very time-consuming, well worth the money spent!
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great starter kit. Some errors
customer_reviews.text: This is a good starter kit for anyone interested in microcontrollers, specifically Arduino. Just know that the edition I received had some errors in the circuits for the relay and the IC. The whole point was to learn about circuits so, I will leave it to you to figure that out since that was the fun part. That it wasn't intentional is a problem though.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Collette

customer_reviews.title: Missing LCD display, but they are express mailing me one!
customer_reviews.text: It came without the LCD Display, though they said they had put in an order and would express mail it to me they received more. They're customer service was VERY nice and helpful. The RGB LED seems busted, but thats a pretty cheap replacement, and I'm sure they would have replaced it if I had bothered to call them back. It'll be 4 stars when my LCD display arrives. Edit: I got my LCD, AND they sent a rangefinder, so... 5 stars, that was really awesome! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Zayin

customer_reviews.title: For beginners
customer_reviews.text: Great product, The manual is very clear and i love the plastic Case for the Arduino. There are only 2 problems with the product. 1. There is no case for the resistors and other Electrical components. 2. The number of sensors is pretty small. Recommended for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Beni

customer_reviews.title: Complete Kit - Decent Value
customer_reviews.text: My son had me purchase this kit as the basis of his college Arduino project. He is using it to count the number of people in a room. I don't knoik he'll need all the pieces, but I guess he could later on when he builds other devices.
customer_reviews.author: Brian M. Mccue

customer_reviews.title: Great starter combo!
customer_reviews.text: Great kit to get started with Arduino! I mainly bought it for the mounting board and experimenting board, plus the sensors. Lots of cool projects, easy to follow instructions!
customer_reviews.author: Eric C. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Best starter kit
customer_reviews.text: Okay, where do I start with this?? This is an amazing starter kit for complete beginners. I love how the sample code (sketches) are explain. They are very detailed and easy to understand, and the wiring diagrams are completely color coded and very easy to follow for those who have absolutely no experience.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo

customer_reviews.title: The nerd you love will thank you, even if it's you.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a birthday present for my son. He's a huge computer/math/how-does-it-work-can-I-do-it-too, kind of guy. He loved it and has augmented it with additional models. Arduino is what you get your STEM oriented kid after the lego, then erector set stages. It's like them, but electronics, and programming.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hosen

customer_reviews.title: What a gift!
customer_reviews.text: My 14-year-old grandson loved his gift this year! He set right to work making a timed-light show. The possibilities are endless for electrical experiments. I bought him a book to give him more ideas than ever, but the instruction book has many of its own, as well. I would recommend this kit to anyone interested in learning about electrical circuitry.
customer_reviews.author: Laney B

customer_reviews.title: Great! Why buy an Arduino?
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for AVR and Arduino projects. It's been work very well for both and is completely Arduino compatible with no gotchas. Why buy an Arduino when you can get this? An Arduino may have better resilience when presented with higher than 5V voltatges...but I haven't put anything past 5v through this...because....well its self explanatory.
customer_reviews.author: Max M

product_meta.title: Vilros Arduino Uno 3 Ultimate Starter Kit Includes 12 Circuit Learning Guide
feature_bullets: Includes Genuine Arduino Uno Rev3 Board
This is the ultimate Arduino Uno kit enough to get you started with hundreds of arduino projects
Bread Board -- Holder -- Jumper Wires -- USB Cable -- LEDs -- DC Motor -- Small Servo -- Relay
Includes a total of over 190 electronic parts and components

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars982 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
